title: time.Parse broken on custom format
body:
time.Parse() doesn't work correctly across timezones. Iâ€™ve tried this on OSX and Linux:

    const shortForm = "2006-Jan-02 15:04 MST"
    originalTime, err := time.Parse(shortForm, "2013-Nov-29 06:00 CST")
    // code that checks err...
    fmt.Println("originalTime", originalTime)
    fmt.Println("originalTime.Unix", originalTime.Unix())
    otherTime, err := time.Parse(shortForm, "2013-Nov-29 07:00 EST")
    // code that checks err...
    fmt.Println("otherTime", otherTime)
    fmt.Println("otherTime.Unix", otherTime.Unix())

When the system is in the CST timezone, I get the following:

originalTime 2013-11-29 06:00:00 -0600 CST
originalTime.Unix 1385726400
otherTime 2013-11-29 06:00:00 -0600 CST
otherTime.Unix 1385726400

Sanity, right? Except if the system timezone is something other than CST. Change it to EST:

originalTime 2013-11-29 06:00:00 +0000 CST
originalTime.Unix 1385704800
otherTime 2013-11-29 07:00:00 -0500 EST
otherTime.Unix 1385726400

Note there are no errors.
